projects.name: joeboylson.us
projects.description: This website: a self-defining project that has evolved as I have.
projects.technologies: React.js, Create React App, Typescript, Express.js, Heroku
projects.synopsis: Over the past 3 years, I've been learning more and more about web development; consequently this website has evolved and changed as I have and has allowed me to explore and implement the technologies that interest me that I might not be able to use at work. It has also given me the chance to try my hand at web design and UI/UX practices. If the pattern continues, I'll probably be re-writing this entire site within a year (so don't get too comfortable).

projects.name: mattboylson.com
projects.description: A portfolio collaboration with designer and relative Matt Boylson
projects.technologies: React.js, Create React App, Typescript, Express.js, Heroku
projects.synopsis: Developing this site with Matt marked a milestone in my career as a Web Developer because this was my first freelance project. Matt came to me with a lot of great ideas and I'm very grateful to him for allowing me to build his site. Because this was a relatively small codebase (and primarily user-facing), we were able to implement a lot of very interesting interactive elements and behaviors. We focused a lot on "the grid", responsive design, and re-usable and modular components.

projects.name: Web Game Development
projects.description: A few web games I created in school that use basic JavaScript strategies
projects.context: Web Game Development Course (University of Cincinnati)
projects.technologies: Vanilla Javascript, RequestAnimationFrame, HTML Canvas, React, Express.js, Heroku

links.text: Live Site (may take a moment to load)

projects.synopsis: Creating these games was a lot of fun and we were able to use a lot of technologies that wouldn't regularly have a place in a standard web application. I aimed to use simple HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for these projects and not use any external libraries except where absolutely necessary (for instance, a library for a collision detection algorithm).

projects.name: A Developer's Resume
projects.description: With so many resume creation tools out there, I chose to use none of them
projects.synopsis: Usually people use a tool to create their resume: not me. Instead, I chose to create my resume as a simple HTML file - for fun. I used html5-to-pdf to convert the HTML file into a PDF. It works great!
